intro: Allosorus nitidulus, commonly known as the smooth allosorus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that appear in umbels. Native to the eastern United States, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant has a short, unbranched stem and is often found in clusters. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and habitat conservation.
